```{r, include=FALSE}
#### Testing bubblepop ####
library(RPostgreSQL)
source("W:\\RDA Team\\R\\credentials_source.R")
source("chart_functions.R")

pillars_conn <- connect_to_db("rjs_pillars")

## load in race metadata
metadata_race_labels <-  dbGetQuery(pillars_conn, "SELECT * FROM metadata_race_labels") %>% 
  select(race_base, race_label_short, race_label_long)

## Load in RJS Pillars data
df <- dbGetQuery(pillars_conn, "SELECT * FROM report_stoprates_race_gang_person") %>% 
  filter(race!="total" & race != "nhpi" & race!= "aian" & !is.na(stop_count) & stop_count != "0") %>% 
  left_join(metadata_race_labels, by = c("race" = "race_base"))

## add methodnote
methodnote <- "All officer-initiated stops made by officers assigned to gang enforcement."

chart <- fx_bubblepopchart(
  df=df, 
  x='race_label_short', 
  y='stop_prc_rate', 
  z='stop_count',
  top_finding=paste0("SDPD officers assigned to gang enforcement disproportionately stop Black and Latinx people compared to other community members"), # this is the top finding from the chart that gets used like a title
  subtitle= paste0("Percent of people stopped by the gang enforcement assignment by race"), # this is the more standard chart title that gets used as a subtitle
  tooltip_text="Out of <b>{point.stop_total_count:.1f}</b> people stopped by officers assigned to gang enforcement, SDPD stopped <b>{point.stop_count:.1f}</b> people perceived as <b>{point.race_label_long:.1f}</b>, or <b>{point.stop_prc_rate:.1f}</b>% of all people stopped.", # customize your tooltip as a statement, calling out rate and count
  caption = paste(sourcenote, racenote, methodnote), # if necessary add a method note between the racenote and sourcenote with a line break, use racenote if graph includes data by race, and always use sourcenote. Each of these are standard objects across all charts
  yaxis_label = "''", #format for your y axis labels
  export_data_label=list(pointFormat='{point.stop_rate_per1k:.1f} per 1K')
)

dbDisconnect(pillars_conn)

```
